title: Years Later, Philippines Reckons With Duterte’s Brutal Drug War
summary: A president’s vow to fight drugs unleashed violence and fostered a culture of impunity. But the crimes are finally getting a look, including from the International Criminal Court.
author: Sui-Lee Wee and Camille Elemia

title: Motorcycles and Mayhem in Ukraine’s East
summary: In the latest tactic for storming trenches, Russians use motorcycles and dune buggies to speed across open space, often into a hail of gunfire.
author: Andrew E. Kramer, Maria Varenikova and Daniel Berehulak

title: With Macron and Biden Vulnerable, So Is Europe
summary: The U.S. presidential debate and Sunday’s snap election in France have emboldened nationalist forces that could challenge NATO and undo the defense of Ukraine.
author: Roger Cohen

title: Reformist Masoud Pezeshkian Reaches Runoff in Iran’s Presidential Election
summary: Candidates in the campaign to fill the seat of President Ebrahim Raisi, who died in a helicopter crash, showed notable candor about the country’s mounting problems.
author: Farnaz Fassihi, Alissa J. Rubin and Russell Goldman

title: Why U.K.’s Young Voters Feel Forgotten by Politicians
summary: Many young people in the northern English cities of Liverpool and Manchester say they feel disillusioned by politics.
author: Megan Specia

title: Defendants Acquitted in Panama Papers Money-Laundering Trial
summary: The case focused on the law firm at the heart of the 2016 scandal, in which leaked documents revealed a vast network of offshore tax havens.
author: Leila Miller

title: How Julian Assange Lit the Fuse on the Digital World
summary: In his brazen quest for total transparency, the WikiLeaks founder paved the way for a world in which no secret is safe and no institution trusted.
author: Mattathias Schwartz

title: Putin Vows to Make New Nuclear Missiles and Weigh Putting Them Near NATO Nations
summary: The announcement appeared to be the Russian leader’s latest attempt to raise the stakes in his conflict with the West, coming less than two weeks after his visit to North Korea.
author: David E. Sanger and Anton Troianovski
tags: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

title: Racist and Homophobic Comments Unsettle U.K. Election Campaign
summary: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak denounced a slur used against him by a man campaigning for Reform U.K., the anti-immigration party led by Nigel Farage.
author: Stephen Castle

title: Debates in U.K. and U.S. Differ Sharply in Tone and Substance
summary: The debates between contenders to be U.K. prime minister showed that Britain’s political culture, and the leaders who have emerged from it, are far removed from those across the ocean.
author: Mark Landler

title: France’s Bold Election Gamble: Here Is What’s at Stake
summary: President Emmanuel Macron’s surprise call for new elections in France’s lower house of Parliament is seen as a risky gamble.
author: Aurelien Breeden

title: Why Britain’s Murky Election Betting Scandal Is Causing Outrage
summary: The embattled Conservative Party is embroiled in investigations over whether some of its own staff members used insider knowledge to bet on the timing of the general election.
author: Rory Smith

title: U.S. Allies in Asia and Europe Watch the Debate With a Question: What Now?
summary: Across Asia and Europe, the event stoked concerns about American stability, both domestically and on crucial foreign policy issues like Washington’s commitment to alliances.
author: Steven Erlanger and Motoko Rich
tags: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

title: Brittany Was Once Barren Ground for France’s Far Right. No More.
summary: The region along the northwest coast has few immigrants and little crime or unemployment, but the far-right National Rally has made inroads saying that all three are coming.
author: Catherine Porter and Dmitry Kostyukov

title: How to Like Yourself More
summary: Taking time to enumerate nice things about yourself each day may sound terminally conceited, but in practice the results can be pretty transformative.
author: Melissa Kirsch

title: A New Home for the Story of the Boats That Shaped Canada
summary: After a last-minute setback, the Canadian Canoe Museum has finally opened its new building in Ontario.
author: Ian Austen

title: A Wish From All Sides to Move On Gives Freedom to Julian Assange
summary: The WikiLeaks founder spent years in captivity in London before talks accelerated this spring, allowing him to go home to Australia as a felon, but a free man.
author: Glenn Thrush and Megan Specia

title: A String of Supreme Court Decisions Hits Hard at Environmental Rules
summary: Four cases backed by conservative activists in recent years have combined to diminish the power of the Environmental Protection Agency.
author: Coral Davenport
tags: Chevron v Natural Resources Defense Council (Supreme Court Decision)

title: Israel’s Plan to Legalize 5 West Bank Settlements: What to Know
summary: Israel says it will legalize five West Bank settlements previously considered illegal, as the government accelerates what critics call a slow-motion annexation of land meant for a Palestinian state.
author: Ephrat Livni
tags: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

title: Beryl, the Season’s First Hurricane, Is Expected to Intensify
summary: The hurricane is expected to intensify quickly and bring significant storm surge to the Windward Islands as a major hurricane, forecasters said on Saturday.
author: Judson Jones and Aimee Ortiz

title: Doris Allen, Analyst Who Saw the Tet Offensive Coming, Is Dead at 97
summary: Her warning of a big buildup of enemy troops poised to attack South Vietnam in 1968 was ignored, a major U.S. Army intelligence failure during the war.
author: Richard Sandomir
tags: United States Defense and Military Forces

title: Before LeBron and Bronny, These Fathers and Sons Made Sports History
summary: The Los Angeles Lakers are poised to have the first father-son N.B.A. duo in league history. But other dads and sons have played pro sports together as well.
author: Victor Mather

title: U.S. Presses to Avert Wider War Between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon
summary: A recent flurry of diplomacy aims to head off a conflict that could pit the United States directly against Iran.
author: Michael Crowley, Julian E. Barnes and Aaron Boxerman

title: Dutch Olympic Organizers Defend Participation of Athlete Convicted of Rape
summary: Steven van de Velde, a beach volleyball player, spent time in prison for the 2014 rape of a 12-year-old girl. His inclusion on the Olympic team has caused a stir in the international news media.
author: Claire Moses

title: Mikhail Baryshnikov on Leaving Everything Behind
summary: Fifty years ago, Baryshnikov defected from the Soviet Union. He discusses that day, the war in Ukraine and the challenges facing Russian artists today.
author: Javier C. Hernández

title: At Euro 2024, a Very England Fight Misses the Point
summary: A back and forth over the pundit’s one-word analysis of his country’s performances rests on a misconception about the media’s role.
author: Rory Smith

title: What I’m Reading: Tunneling to the Past
summary: Looking for answers, or an escape, in a fraught world.
author: Amanda Taub

title: Princess Anne Returns Home From the Hospital After Suffering Concussion
summary: Anne, the younger sister of King Charles III, suffered a concussion and other injuries in an accident at her country residence, palace officials said.
author: Mark Landler
tags: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

title: Israeli Minister Reportedly Agrees to Release Funds to the Palestinian Authority
summary: Under a tentative deal, Israel’s far-right finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, would help the Palestinian Authority stave off financial collapse if five illegal West Bank outposts are authorized.
author: Aaron Boxerman and Adam Rasgon

title: For An Aquatic Veterinarian, It’s Never ‘Just A Fish’
summary: Stress, ovarian cancer, buoyancy disorders: Every pet has its troubles, and needs a good doctor who makes house calls.
author: Emily Anthes and Nic Coury

title: What the Impressionist Painter Camille Pissarro Saw in London
summary: A writer used Camille Pissarro’s paintings of suburban London and a ‘lost’ railway as a lens for exploring the city’s history — and settling an arcane mystery.
author: Mike Ives

title: 7.2-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Peru, Injures 3
summary: A tsunami alert was lifted about an hour after the quake struck off the coast of the southern region of Arequipa.
author: John Yoon

title: No Appendix, No Problem. Australia’s Remote Doctors Tell All.
summary: Being the only physician around for hundreds of miles isn’t always bad. “It’s quite liberating to be like, ‘I’m the best person here for the job’,” said one doctor.
author: Julia Bergin

title: Friday Briefing
summary: Biden stumbled in the first 2024 debate.
author: Daniel E. Slotnik

title: Iran Holds Vote to Pick a President
summary: The latest polling suggested Dr. Masoud Pezeshkian, a reformist candidate, was in the lead, but not enough to avoid a runoff.
author: Farnaz Fassihi and Alissa J. Rubin

title: Iran’s Presidential Candidates: Who Are They?
summary: Four of the six candidates selected by officials to run in Iran’s special presidential election are still in the running after the president died in a helicopter crash last month.
author: Eve Sampson

title: Roof Collapses at Delhi Airport Terminal Amid Storms and Heavy Rain
summary: At least one person was killed when parts of the roof caved in and crushed vehicles at Indira Gandhi airport in New Delhi, according to an official. All domestic departures were suspended.
author: Victoria Kim and Suhasini Raj

title: President Luis Arce of Bolivia Confronts a Coup Attempt, and Evo Morales
summary: After facing down the general who tried to oust him, President Luis Arce is battling a more formidable figure, Evo Morales, a former president who wants to reclaim power.
author: Julie Turkewitz, María Silvia Trigo and Genevieve Glatsky
tags: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

title: These Are the Officials Selected for the Top E.U. Jobs
summary: Europe will need to navigate turmoil at home and a potential Trump presidency abroad. These people were picked to steer its institutions for the next five years.
author: Matina Stevis-Gridneff

title: Friday Briefing: What to Watch in the French Election
summary: Also, the upcoming U.S. presidential debate and the vote in Iran.
author: Amelia Nierenberg
tags: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

title: Taiwanese Are Told to Avoid China After It Threatens Independence Backers
summary: Beijing released new rules calling for execution of “diehard” Taiwanese independence supporters, as hostilities surrounding Taiwan’s status rise.
author: Eve Sampson

title: Critically Ill Children Allowed to Leave Gaza for First Time Since May
summary: Israel said the operation was carried out in coordination with the U.S. and others, and that 68 people, including sick and injured patients and their escorts, were allowed to leave.
author: Aaron Boxerman

title: Study Finds Small Streams, Recently Stripped of Protections, Are a Big Deal
summary: Half of the water flowing through regional river basins starts in so-called ephemeral streams. Last year, the Supreme Court curtailed federal protections for these waterways.
author: Brad Plumer

title: As Iran Picks a President, a Nuclear Shift: Open Talk About Building the Bomb
summary: Iran has expanded its most sensitive nuclear production site in recent weeks. And for the first time, some leaders are dropping their insistence that the nuclear program is for peaceful purposes.
author: David E. Sanger and Farnaz Fassihi
tags: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

title: At Least 750,000 on Brink of Starvation and Death in Sudan, Experts Warn
summary: A devastating civil war is pushing the country toward a full-blown famine, according to the international body that measures hunger.
author: Declan Walsh

title: Kenya Protesters Call for President to Resign Despite His Withdrawal of the Tax Bill
summary: The demonstrations were held despite his withdrawal of the tax bill that sparked days of protests. Some activists, fearing more bloodshed, warned people not to march to the president’s official residence.
author: Abdi Latif Dahir

title: The Last Stand of the Woolly Mammoths
summary: The species survived on an island north of Siberia for thousands of years, scientists reported, but were most likely plagued by genetic abnormalities.
author: Carl Zimmer

title: Russian Casualties in Ukraine Mount, in a Brutal Style of Fighting
summary: More than 1,000 Russian soldiers in Ukraine were killed or wounded on average each day in May, according to NATO and Western military officials.
author: Julian E. Barnes, Eric Schmitt and Marc Santora

title: How to Escape From the Russian Army
summary: Facing grim job prospects, a young Nepali signed up to join Russia’s military, which sent him to fight in Ukraine. His ordeal of combat, injury and escape turned into a tale worthy of Hollywood.
author: Bhadra Sharma and Jeffrey Gettleman

title: China Levels Graft Charges Against Former Defense Ministers
summary: The two generals were accused of taking huge bribes and of corruption that reached into the armaments sector, indicating that the country’s military has not shaken off old habits.
author: Chris Buckley

title: Will Extreme Heat Hold Back Saudi Arabia and Other Gulf States?
summary: The high temperatures blamed for the deaths of pilgrims in Saudi Arabia are taking a broad toll in countries that have spent vast sums to attract tourists and investors.
author: Ben Hubbard

title: Israel Orders More Evacuations in Gaza as Military Fights Hamas in Shajaiye
summary: Palestinian officials and residents described strikes and blasts as Israel’s public broadcaster reported that the Israeli military had returned to fight Hamas in Gaza City’s east.
author: Hiba Yazbek, Ephrat Livni, Ameera Harouda and Eric Nagourney

title: Israeli Soldier Is Killed During Raid in West Bank, IDF Says
summary: As well as the officer who died, another was severely wounded during the operation in Jenin, a bastion of armed resistance to Israel’s occupation. One Palestinian was also reported wounded.
author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg

title: How a Tiny Circle of Advisers Helped Prod Macron to Call France’s Snap Election
summary: President Emmanuel Macron’s governing style has always been intensely top-down. But with far-right nationalists in France closing in on power, some believe he may have gone too far this time.
author: Roger Cohen

title: Amsterdam Museum to Return a Matisse Work Sold Under Duress in World War II
summary: The painting, “Odalisque,” was sold to the Stedelijk Museum in the early 1940s by a German-Jewish family desperate to escape the Nazis.
author: Nina Siegal

title: Shahjahan Bhuiya, Executioner Turned TikTok Star, Dies in Bangladesh
summary: He hanged high-profile inmates in exchange for a reduction in his own robbery and murder sentences, and became a social media sensation after his release.
author: Saif Hasnat and Yan Zhuang

title: Iranians Say, ‘We Have Been Going Backward’
summary: Iranians say they have little faith their votes in Friday’s presidential election will improve their lives, and many are planning to sit it out.
author: Alissa J. Rubin

title: Julian Assange’s Polarizing Legacy: From Hacker to Hunted Figure
summary: The co-founder of WikiLeaks was a heroic crusader for truth to many people for publishing government secrets. To others, he was a reckless leaker endangering lives.
author: Mark Landler and Megan Specia

title: Trump Eyes Bigger Trade War in Second Term
summary: The former president’s past tariffs raised prices for consumers and businesses, economists say. His next plan could tax 10 times as many imports.
author: Ana Swanson and Alan Rappeport

title: The Etiquette of Remembering Your Friend’s Pet’s Name
summary: At a barbershop in Colorado, stylists and customers discussed a matter of social protocol.
author: Matt Richtel and Theo Stroomer

title: Thursday Briefing
summary: Evan Gershkovich’s trial began in Russia.
author: Daniel E. Slotnik
